text: Our family had the absolute pleasure of staying in the Akasha Villas, Seminyak in September 2009 and it was simply gorgeous. We stayed in Villa 10 which was one of the furthest from the reception (quiet and very private). It had 3 bedrooms with private pool, full kitchen, large dining and living room, which we shared between 3 couples and 2 children. The Villa was so spacious that we were never in each others way. The Villas were beautiful (and for once every bit as good as the pictures on the web). We had an absolute ball there and it was great to be able to walk to the beach and the 'local' restaurant (Warang Sobat), and at the same time be away from the crowds at Kuta and busier central Seminyak. We caught a taxi to everywhere we needed to go that was beyond walking distance for the children in the heat of the day (Kuta and Seminyak for shopping, Canggu for the Echo Beach Cafe and dinner at the glamorous Seminyak restaurants). The management were very friendly and helpful organising transport for whole day outings to Ubud and airport transfers.  The house staff were delightful and my children particularly warmed to one of the girls who made the mistake of laughing at their pool antics.  After that they rushed back after every outing to see if she was around so they could say hi!!   We have just booked a return visit for July 2010 and my children have insisted on Villa 10 again (and I agreed as the layout, decor position within the complex was perfect!)
title: Luxurious Villa walking distance to beach made for an amazing holiday

text:
The highest luxury villa with very good service. It is really 24 hour as promised. Whenever you need service , they will see to serve you in timely manner. Even we called to clean up our dishes at 11pm on NYE2022.  In the morning they cook your breakfast in your kitchen and serve one by one on your table. The BBQ menu is WOW. We ordered for 10 ppl, but i think 20 ppl cannot even finish it. 

If you look forward to pampering yourself while in Bali, stay here. Right in the heart of batubelig. Mari Beach club is next door. Close to canggu, seminyak and a lot of resto and cafe by just walking distance. And  also beach is just some steps away
title: Year End with Akasha

text: The hotel is centrally located.  Comfortable beds.  Nice service.  Small but lovely pool.  There is a coffee machine in the room, it's really fun to wake up in the morning with a cup of fresh coffee. Ask breakfast for the room.
title: Nice hotel

locations.name: The Akasha Luxury Villas & Boutique Hotel

text:
We only stayed in this hotel for one night. 
Nothing to say about the room, but a lot to say about the disorganization. I had requested in the morning at 10 to find a scooter ready at 16. They replied that the scooter was ready. At 5pm it was still not available. We were told it was due to traffic. In 2 minutes we found a scooter by ourselves and moved smoothly through traffic. Due to their disorganization we were unable to respect the schedules of our day and we lost the entrance to a Temple already paid. Really bad, you made fun of us!
title: Very bad experience

owner_response.text: Dear Ginnipooh22, I am sorry to hear about this experience. As we investigate the case, our staff has already helped to order the scooter from third party, however the rental company claimed that there was unexpected accident happened that caused delay in the delivery. We tried finding you a new scooter but unfortunately it was too late for you. Thank you again for your feedback and we do hope we can make it up to you on your next trip. Best regards

text:
We stayed for almost a week here in June 2019 and absolutely loved the place!

We got a room by the swimming pool and whether it was due to low season or just because it’s very few rooms on the floor, we felt like it was our private pool - almost never saw our neighbors :)

The rooms are clean, stylish and spacious. Bathrooms are modern. The staff was fantastic - friendly and happy to help with any request. It’s also one of the main reasons why we would stay again. We were also getting our breakfast to the room every morning which was great.  

The hotel doesn’t have its own kitchen, but they order food from a near by restaurant as we understood it. The food was delicious - we ended up ordering lunch every day. It is also surprisingly cheap compared to prices in the cafes near by, with quality being as good. 

The beach is just 2 mins away, also there is a liquor store within 5 mins walking distance and a 7-Eleven near by. Lots of places to eat out around, and about 20 mins walk down the beach to the main beach clubs.

We will certainly be coming back, thank you for making our stay perfect.
title: Would stay again!

text: Had an excellent stay with amazing staff. Room was huge and very clean. Good location in Seminyak. Special thank you to Upik who helped us unpack and get ready for airport after our massage with the hotel. She was very kind and went above and beyond.
title: Nice stay

text:
We had just stayed four nights in Ubud in a bamboo house that might be described as a compound of several houses that were its rooms and living areas. It was on a hill surrounded by a bamboo forest overlooking the Ayung river in the Green Village. It was a novelty my husband wanted to experience. Though the bamboo house was luxurious and had the comforts of home, such as air conditioning, a full-service kitchen, a pool ... it lacked what this Akasha villa offered--a sense of togetherness between the three rooms even if its buildings were still separated. Doors opened to the pool letting in the pool and the other rooms, and I did swim with the living room doors open to watch CNN, while at times floating on my back to watch the sky. Couldn't help but notice that one of the frangipani trees overhanging the pool might be sick. Its leaves looked crumpled and shrunk by pestilence.

The breakfast, served in the villa, ticked off from a limited menu the day before at the reception, was standard and not quite memorable, although the service can't be faulted.

The Akasha property is really just a walk to the beach. Some might think one of its faults is that you don't quite get the beachfront experience. While that might be true, one could look at it as having the choice of turning the party off.

Unfortunately, the choice of a late checkout, given the very late flights out of Bali, wasn't offered because they were booked. It would've been considerate if that were made available to guests, given its premium rates.

Overall, I would stay here again.
title: Villa No. 9

Dear TravelingPinay
Thank you for staying with us. We are glad you likes the atmosphere and layout of our property. We take note of your comments about the frangipani and breakfast. We are sorry we could not give you a late checkout because of the next booking, please do let us know if you have any further inquiry, we are happy to hear from you, and looking forward to see you in the future :)

text:
I choose to book Akasha due to its location and beautiful interiors, mostly.
It was convenient for my solo trip and first visit to Bali. 

1. Location.
It’s in Seminyak. To get out I was using taxi a lot (it’s pretty affordable there), so didn’t get a chance to explore immediate neighborhood, except for one small mini market around the corner where you can get some essentials like toothpaste. You will also find in the room the description of the walking route across nearby beaches - amazing way to explore that area with some famous Bali beach clubs.

2. Reception and area.
The reception area and staff are really lovely and attentive to details. Hotel has both villas and rooms and pretty spacious area. There is also a security post at the entrance gate. 

3. Rooms.
I stayed in a room, didn’t check their villas. They offer few rooms with unique design each, which makes wow-effect. ‘Flamingo’ Deluxe room was allocated for me upon my arrival - with paintings of flamingos on the walls, I didn’t like it (too dark colors are not for me) and asked if I can occupy another room, which I saw on pictures while booking. The second room’s decorations I loved so much! It was beach or marine theme with white & blue colors in its decor. Lots of pillows on bed and sofa, nice wall panel over the bed and morrow frame made of shells (omg!). They also offer nice wicker beach bag. Small things like box made in very Balinese style for jewelries, bedside table and lampshade, also the sliding door to the shower and bathroom area and panels there, even cups in a small kitchenette - all are very authentic and seem to be parts of very well thinker out design. 

4. Facilities.
There is small gym-room upstairs, which has glass walls (for me was ok) - equipment is pleasant to use. Area in front of the rooms is a pool area, the pool is literally one step away from your doorstep, yet there is a space for some small sitting area in front of the room. Sun is there in the morning. Good for some sunbathing after morning swim. There only 3 rooms situated on the ground floor, so, it’s pretty quite and there is privacy. Breakfast can be served to your room as well as in the lounge, which is across the area in front of the reception - nice and beautifully decorated space overlooking some villas courtyard with kitchen and mini-library area. You get to choose your breakfast menu and time in advance, however the food need to be improved: hash browns were over fried and poached eggs were completely liquid (even and egg write), so I just decided to skip breakfasts after my first day experience.

All in all, it was an amazing Bali experience, I would recommend it to friends and will stay there on our next trip with my partner!
title: Very Instagramable room design

text:
It was our first time in Bali. We have decided to make a reservation for this place because of the really good reviews. We stayed in a junior suite and there are a few things that did not go really well
- the room is noisy and you can hear the traffic all day and all night long
- the shower head in our room was partially blocked so it made it difficult to take a quick shower
- the breakfast must be chosen the day before and also need to comunicate the timing (there is no breakfast place, you must eat in your room or in the common space of your villa)
- breakfast pastries tasted like supermarket ones
- we used the laundry facility ( overpriced) and although they washed, dried and ironed our clothes the same day, 2 of our jumpers went from black to grey ( maybe they dried the clothes under the sun
- we rented a scooter from the hotel which was old and making weird noises. One of the helmets was broken and when I asked for it to be replaced, the receptionist offered me to borrow her helmet ( extremely nice of her, but not what you expect for). We decided to pay for one day rental anyway but we took a taxi to move around instead. 

Positive aspects:
- the rooms are bigger than what they seem in pictures
- daily cleaning service of the room was impeccable 
- every single staff member was extremely nice and friendly
- the pool area was cleaned daily
- the location is good for what we needed

I decided to give 4 stars for the staff members and for the cleanliness of this place. The rooms need some maintenance and the services offered should be improved. 

Honestly, unfortunately I would not choose this place again.
title: I wish I could say it was perfect..

text:
We have had a wonderful time during our stay at Akasha villas. We are a family with small kids and booked a 3 bedroom and it is perfect. The rooms are all separate from the living area so it made it simple to put the kids to bed and still access the pool and lounge room and kitchen to make noise. Great pool, very comfy beds, 3 huge bathrooms, amazing breakfast cooked for you in your villa. Walking distance to some great places to eat and only a short taxi ride to a lot more in Seminyak,or you have the option of the free shuttle service to drop you off anywhere.
A big thank you to all the staff as you did a great job looking after us from the moment we arrived. We arrived before check in and they made us comfortable in another villa before ours was ready. Our flights were delayed so they also gave us a late check out, so our baby could sleep. All of these added extras made it such a stress free, relaxing holiday. We will be happy to come back again on our next visit to Bali.
title: Relaxing family escape

text:
The villa was beautiful in its design (#10), the swimming pool is just big and really beautiful, the bathrooms are outside AND inside that was important to us, the staff is really friendly, its a pleasure talking with them, they always offer to help and in case of problem, available late at night. The birds and friendly fauna made it an incredible journey, no pests apart a few mosquitoes at dusk (they spray around the villa), so many birds chirping, geckos, frogs and bats, we were in a really friendly bubble, the kids loved it! The location close to the beach is good with some restaurants & delis nearby. 
A few problems though, the AC in both bedrooms had issues, one seized functionning but was fixed ASAP late at night, the other one in the master bedroom was really very loud and working so so, we slept very good, but from time to time we were a bit annoyed and had to stop it during the night. Akasha management needs to replace that unit someday! I guess that villa is pretty much rented whole year around so there is a bit of wear showing on some minor equipment, the sliding door from the dining/salon will give up someday, hinges are weak!  Some of the towels were a bit worn out, but nothing horrible, its still good!
The Akasha is a bit pricier than some other places in the neighborhood, but it is really a good spot and a fair option, at least when it comes to our villa, we really enjoyed our stay and we even invited some friends who actually leave in Bali for a drink and a snack and they thought the villa was fine too.
We might be back!
title: Excellent location, beautiful Villa and nice staff, some caveats but very good

Fantastic location 5 mins walk across the beach to Potato Head and the W . 5 mins more and your at Seminyak Square. No need for lengthy taxi rides. Close to Barbacoa and Sardine in a taxi . If your a couple and want a flop and drop then maybe it’s for you . Pool was clean and inviting . 

Breakfast delivered to room was cold and inedible . Tried cooked and continental . Yuk ! Housekeeping was poor. Soiled bloodied dried sheet put on our bed . Had to chase housekeeping to change . Someone else’s medication left in the bedside cabinet . Not ideal with children ! Booked a two bed was given a 3 which was great until we were asked to pick two rooms as that’s all we had paid for and the other door locked . Hardly a great start to a luxury villa . Bathroom toiletries not replaced once used . Leaky shower and air conditioner . Staff pleasant but not overly accommodating . Check out was ridiculous . Come to inspect room and check if you haven’t stolen the hairdryer or the pool baskets ! Very uncomfortable feeling . It was all about the money no genuine service or hospitality . Very pricey for what you get and far better alternatives at that price point . Very disappointed . We are a family travelling with 2 children .
title: Not a luxury villa

owner_response.text:
Dear Hesseytenny
Thank you for sharing your constructive feedback with us. We are glad to hear you love our location, pool and villa, however we are sorry to hear that you are dissatisfied with some issues. We have immeaditely called for inspection throughout related departments. Your points have been noted and fixed for better service in the future. Despite of the very busy season we are trying to provide the best service and making sure our guest feel comfortable. We do have a policy of locking one or two bedroom of the villa that are not in use if you are provided with a villa bigger than the category you reserved. Also provide a standard check out procedure to check through the villa and minibar also for your safety incase anything is left behind. We will look into this policy should it offend our guest in any way. Noted on the bed linen and toiletteries, we make sure our guest is fully equipped and provided with comfortable and clean ammenities. Thank you for your stay, we do hope we can provide better experience in the future. We do hope we can welcome you again to stay with us and make sure you will have an enjoyable stay, please contact us directly incase you need any further assistance.

text:
If you love the Canggu / Seminyak area this place is perfect. Akasha, is on the boarder of the two, making it a quick walk to the beach, grab some corn and a beer at Sunset.  Take a walk south to the W, Potato Head in less than 10 mins or be on Seminyak main beach where there is heaps to do 20 mins or so.  Go north and get to Old Mans in 15 mins. If you love a wave this is a great place to stay.  Side note the little spa salon over the road is well priced and the ladies are lovely.   

The villas themselves are spacious and comfortable. The Tv’s are new and the showers have great water pressure.  One last thought the in room dining is one of the best we have had in Bali with great local and international options.

We will definitely come back and I hope you and your family enjoy also.

text:
We have stayed in several hotels during our stay in Bali, and The Akasha was by far the most disappointing of them all. Even a cheaper, low cost villa in Jimbaran for $60 a night was far better value than this place.

1. For the price, and the name "luxury", it wasn't all that luxurious at all compared to the other hotels in the area. The lobby was simple and unimpressive, so was the room. It didn't feel like it was worth the price we paid for the room compared to other establishments. My last hotel had a huge bath tub, bath salts AND bath foam and The Akasha doesn't even provide a toothbrush set. I thought that was a basic standard??

2. The bathroom had a stink of sewerage as soon as you step in. It was disgusting.

3. The location is pretty far from the main shopping areas of Seminyak, but it is very near to the (quieter part) of the beach. Perhaps it's only plus point. We only found out on the last day when my spa transport failed to arrive, that they provide free transportation around Seminyak if their vehicle is available. Why were we not told during check-in? It would've saved us a lot of time trying to Grab/Go-jek to where we wanted to go.

4. Our TV was blurry and unfocused, like a 3D movie without glasses. We called for help on our first night, and all the technician did was toggle the wires (we had already tried that). They said they would fix it in the morning, but they never did. Probably hoping I'd just forget about it.

5. We accidentally broke a shower bottle, because they had a genius idea of putting glass bottles on slippery, wet shower ledges. They made us pay 150,000rp for it, an obviously inflated and overpriced cost for such an item in Bali. Even though we explained that it was an accident, they said it was "the procedure" and they'd "have to charge". The lack of empathy here is astounding, and is $15 really worth a customer's bad experience of your establishment? All they did was say they'd take the feedback to consideration.

Would I come here again? DEFINITE NO.

After reading another negative comment below, I'm happy that I at least managed to get a villa that's not by the side of the road and it was at least, quiet. Thank god.
title: Poor value, not recommended!

owner_response.text:
Dear vanillafrog

Thank you for sharing your feedback with us on Tripadvisor. We do appreciate hearing from our guests as it will improve our standard of service for our guests.

Please accept our apologies for the unpleasant experience. Noted on you comment for the shampoo bottle, as this is the first incident at our hotel, we will surely consider replacing this for our safety. Oral B Toothbrush is also a standard feature in our every room, we regret that our Housekeeping had missed placing them in your room and we have taken immediate action on this matter. Also we have immediately coordinate with our technical department regarding the TV and bathroom.

We sincerely hope that the recent stay had not marred your impression you have on us as we will look forward to having another privilege of welcoming you again in the near future.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
I booked this Villa for a special occasion and I was very disappointed with our stay. But let's start with the few good things. Villa is spacious and we liked the location, close to the beach and close to nice beach bars, as well as to some good restaurants at Batu Belig. It's definitely the quieter part of Seminyak, which we liked a lot. The staff is friendly although they did nothing about our complaint on the 1st day. 

We stayed at Villa No 11 wich was right on a corner (noise from two roads). Very noisy from random traffic sounds, continuous honking by motorbikes and cars as they went round the corner. You could hear this from the bedroom - all through the night. As we saw some more villas further away from the roads we asked for a move to another villa. Staff said they were fully booked, but on all the booking sites there was availability for villas. 

2nd night in the villa, the neighbour villa had a Party which of course is fine but around midnight you would think the management would go and tell them to turn down the music and keep the noise to a minimum. Nothing happened and the party was going strong till 2.30am. I guess I don’t have to say that we didn’t sleep a lot that night either. 

Villas are quite dark and nothing like on the picture. To reduce the noise from the street they put a 4-5meter high bamboo wall on top of the concrete wall, so nothing like on the picture where the villa is situated in a lush green garden. 

When we arrived the quality of the water in our pool was poor and the water was not clear. Nothing was done until the last day ,when without asking us, the pool guys came and put a lot of chemicals in the pool. When we asked when the pool was ready to use again, the answer was 3pm in the afternoon. And this on our last day!! 

Lots of mosquitos everywhere but especially around the daybed in the garden. We could not use it at all! When we told this to the staff they handed a bottle of mosquito spray and told us to use generously. When we complained again they arranged for pest control, also on our last day. We had at least a few mosquito free hours...!

Room service had to be reminded to refill shampoo/coffee etc. 

People would just walk into the villa unannounced, no bell ringing, just walked in completely unannounced, removing all sense of privacy. 

Rain shower doesn't work and needs to be fixed. 

I might have to say, I’ve been living in Asia since 10 years and I’m a frequent traveler and I see a lot of accommodations especially pool Villas. I travel to Bali 3-4 times a year and unfortunately I have to say this was by far the worst stay in a Pool Villa. There are so many other nice villas available in Seminyak and surroundings for far less money! 

Staff asked us at the checkout if we would come back. Our answer was: NO!

Please also change your name, there is nothing luxury about your hotel/villas!
title: Not worth the money and please remove "Luxury" from the description!

text: It was a very luxurious 4 bed villa which was perfect for our family of 8 ppl. Each bedroom had an ensuite huge bathroom which had an option of shower and bath tub both (indoor and outdoor both). We would wake up to the scrumptious aroma of the breakfast being prepared by the in-house chef in our villa's living room/kitchen. Accompanied by freshly squeezed watermelon juice! The staff was very friendly and accommodating and helpful in every way that they could. The best part was the pool .Each bedroom and even the living room had the view of the pool! The kids enjoyed to the fullest and it was a good family get together for us since we all live in different cities ! Would def go here again ! Its a two minute walk from the beach and a lot of Bars and restaurants in the area but it's a fairly quieter area then the Kuta beach area...Which was good for us as we were looking for some peace and quiet. There were a number of spas and massage parlours within a two mins walk and the most convenient was the mini Mart across the street opened 24 hours.

text:
We were a party of six and stayed in the 4 bedroom villa (Villa No 1). My wife and I had surveyed this villa in a previous trip to the area and this should be one of the biggest I've seen. 

The rooms are also huge and each comes with an attached toilet, with outdoor showers and tubs as well. The most impressive feature for families has got to be the living area where we have our meals and long conversations. It really is an excellent place to chill.

The pool is large (for a villa I reckon), I would say about 15-20m long. There is also a jacuzzi and pavilion within the villa compounds. We really have no complaints about the villa.

Unfortunately, the fitness centre (and lobby) were under renovation when we were there in Dec 17.

The Akasha is also quite well placed in Seminyak. Not smack into the red-hot Seminyak Square area, but close enough to walk to some Bali institutions like the Hog Wild, 707 Beach Bar, La Laguna. You could even walk along the beach to PotatoHead Beach Club about a kilometre away.
title: Beautiful spacious villa in Seminyak

text:
We had an amazing stay at Akasha Villa, the Villa itself was beautiful, spacious and really well appointed, we travelled as two families with two young children, and with the addition of a pool fence the space was perfect.  

The other highlight is the service, all of the staff were extremely accommodating, able to help with any number of requests, and they were all lovely with the kids.  We had a in villa bbq one evening as a birthday celebration which was amazing, and highly recommended.

The location is good, in that it's between Seminyak and Canggu providing relatively easy access to both (when there's not one of the hourly traffic jams...) and the Villa provides a free shuttle on request to nearby locations which is great.  The beach is a quick 5 min walk away, and there are a number of convenience stores and places to eat nearby, but you'll need a shuttle if you want to get to the main drag in Seminyak.  

We were in Villa 11 which was great, close to reception, however it did seem to get inundated with smoke from the incinerator a couple of times over the week we were there.  Some the Villas further from reception might be better?

text:
Absolutely the worst villa we've ever rented in Bali, by a very long margin, and we have stayed in many villas in Bali (we live in Jakarta).  We checked out after only a day, and sacrificed a day's rental, which the management said they would consider reimbursing ("please don't write a negative Tripadvisor review about us"), which of course they never did repay; they never even responded to our reminders of their promises.  So I am writing my Tripadvisor report now!

What was wrong?

1. Very noisy from random traffic sounds (and to be fair, not all their villas are not all like this, we were just "unlucky" with the villa they assigned to us).  The road outside our villa was obviously on a corner, so continuous honking by motorbikes and cars as they went round the corner).  You could hear this from the bedroom - all through the night.

2. Bathroom smelt like everyone who had used the shower in the last 3 months had decided to treat it like a toilet. The odour of urine was quite overpowering. They clearly do not want to invest in even just a bottle of bleach.  It stank - I would hold my breath when going to the bathroom (using the toilet, unlikely everyone else, who seemed to have used the shower).

3. The aircon in the bedroom would "beep" every 3 minutes.  Had to notify the staff of this, despite they had clearly cleaned the room and listened to this continuously.  Turned out it was a warning by the aircon for something or other, but nevertheless, why is it up to the guests to notice this kind of fault?  Most of the aircons were poor quality / old, ie didn't keep rooms cool, especially the lounge.  This is a minor fault, but reflects on the attitude of the staff.

4. The TV in the lounge had incredibly distorted sound, making it useless.

5. The flooring inside the villa and outside on the pool deck was really seriously warped, so high chance of getting wood splinters, trips & falls, and obviously chance of falling in the pool high.  Not good when one has a 2-year old.  The buckling inside the villa in one place was like an inch high, so you would always trip on this.  

6. The room service food was absolutely vile.  No other word for it.  Inedible.  They clearly expect people will go out (which one obviously should, but we were tired when arriving the first night, and just wanted to relax (how unreasonable!!)).  They should just do what other places do, which call out food from nearby restaurants.  They make the mistake of cooking themselves, and probably get the toilet cleaner to do the cooking, he obviously has a lot of time on his hands as he never cleans the toilet!  And whilst I rarely complain about the price - this was unbelievable.  A pizza (which, as mentioned, was inedible, clearly a frozen pizza poorly prepared) cost something like Rp 150,000!!!  Why couldn't they just call Dominos?

7. There was litter all around the villa when we arrived (I spent the first 5 minutes picking up sweet wrappers, adverts for massages etc strewn around the garden).

8. People would just walk into the villa unannounced (e.g. to work out why aircon was beeping), no bell ringing, just walked in completely unannounced, removing all sense of privacy.  

Unbelievably awful.  The fact that we decided to sacrifice an entire day's rental says it all.  Never again, even if it was free.

And some other advice - not all villas ask for upfront payments.   I am writing this now from a very nice villa (Dusun) who don't require any deposits.  I think I know why Akasha requires deposits - because they know there is a risk people will leave early.

Looking at the other reports, some people (not all) clearly had a nice stay here, which recognising the nice location, is definitely possible.  We did stay here about 2 years ago, and it was fine.  I suspect our room was a particularly awful room, but the attitude of the staff, lack of proper cleaning etc tells me that the villas has been on a downward slope, incredibly badly managed, no money going in for upkeep (e.g. replacing the wood flooring, cleaning the toilet/shower to get rid of the urine smell).  So in other words while some villas are better than others, there is an endemic management / investment issue that will expose customers to having a poor stay regardless of the villa choice, I believe.  If you "feel lucky" then stay here.  Otherwise, stay well away.
title: Awful, will never go back.  So many better options in Bali.

text:
Initial perception of the hotel was great - the layout of the rooms and the pool is really good. The kitchen is outstanding. The shame is that this place seems to be going down hill and it doesn't look like anyone is too bothered. Normally i wouldn't whinge like this but it was such a let down based on the price we paid and we had our iphone stolen from our luggage in our room - perhaps this place was great 5 years ago?

Service - Some of the staff were great, mainly the staff who cooked breakfast and room service. really friendly and they really try (although sometimes the breakfast was cold) - the hospitality staff were rubbish (to say the least). We had to ask for towels and toilet paper (the towels were small and thin) and even after we asked, it took them hours to deliver it. Lastly, they were smoking out the villa next door with what seemed like burnt plastic but perhaps it was to kill the insects - there was this smoke EVERYWHERE and we were trying to swim with our 6 month old in the pool. What was it? DDT? something noxious...  I cant think what else they were doing?

The Villa - Great layout - Pool is awesome - Kitchen is dreamlike - Great room sizes - Great beds - BUT..... going down hill fast. Termites are destroying the wooden floors (the are buckled in the rooms) - Outside showers either don't work at alll or the shower heads spray water against the top of the wall instead of down. Inside bathroom was really nice which made up for it. 

Overall - they really can rescue this place but it needs some money spent on it and needs someone to do something with their hospitality staff . Lastly - fix your wireless!!!
title: Villa going down hill

owner_response.text:
Dear Nigel157 

We very much appreciate your comments regarding your stay at the The Akasha Villas. It is always a pleasure to receive positive feedback.

First we would like to apologize that you lost your iphone. As you may aware our management have taken very serious action to this case. We have reported to the police and they have been doing some investigation and interviewed our all staff including check our security and SOP.
Police officer was also asked the possibility that you left your iphone during dinner or shopping or sight visit outside villa area. Until now we are still asked the police officer to continue the investigation among our staff and villa. 

Regarding smoke that you saw from your villa, our neighboring villas had a scheduled fogging to minimize or kill mosquitoes during rainy season.

Thank you for your concern to our villa especially wooden floor. Our chief engineer with management have checked and taken further action to any facilities which may no longer appropriate or may need to refurbish or replace to make sure our guests a comfortable stay.

Once again Thank you for sharing your experience, and we hope you will stay with us again in the future so we can show you the changed of our services and facilities. 

Best regards,
Akasha Bali management
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
When we first arrived to the villa, we thought it was big and beautiful. A big villa with a private pool, the room looked nice and tidy. But we did notice the air-conditioning was not strong enough in the bedroom. 

In the next day or so we started to notice other things; there were ants/termites every where! It was rather disgusting. The bath towels were old and ragged. Despite having a private pool, no pool towels were provided without calling reception. We ran out of toilet paper and it took over an hour after our call to reception for more to arrive. The wi-fi keeps dropping out. The doors don't shut properly. The floor boards were loose and warped in the bedroom, making it very noisy to walk around when there is a sleeping baby in the room. Breakfast was prepared in the kitchen area of the villa, but it is almost always cold (I believe they just microwave everything). And worse of all, our mobile phone was stolen from our bedroom. 

The lesson here; never have them clean your villa without you being present.
title: Expected better

owner_response.text:
Dear thaifly0306,
Thank you for taking time to share your experience during stay with us.
First much regret that you lost your iphone. After we received your reported, We have taken very serious action to this case. We have reported to the police. Immediately They have gone through some investigation in our villa and interviewed all staff. Check security and villa SOP, have been done. 
The police officer was also asked the possibility that you brought your iphone during went out for dinner or to the shops or sightseeing outside our villa area.

With regard to your comment to our breakfast, please be informed that breakfast is prepared and cooked at your villa kitchen 30 minutes before your breakfast time start. When time for breakfast ready but our guest still felt on sleep, our butler will leave the breakfast at dining table. To keep our guests privacy, we do not want to disturb or wake up our guests especially there is a baby sleeping.
But of course if you inform our butler and allow them to wake you up when breakfasts are ready, they would be happy to call you in the room not let the food cold.

Thank you for your valuable review which we believe it will encourage our team to continuously improve our services and facilities to make our guests a comfortable stay.

We do hope to welcoming you again at our villa in the future.

Best regards,
Akasha Villas Management
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We were lucky enough to rent a 4 bedroom villa and could not believe our good fortune, as the place was amazing!!! .. The staff were exceptionally helpful and accommodating. The villa was spacious and so beautifully designed and so comfortable, that we didn't want to leave.

Sandy, the manager, was wonderful in assisting us with our onward accommodation. We went to Sanur and returned again, as we missed the beautiful villa, the spaciousness, the friendly staff, the privacy, awesome breakfasts, afternoon teas and cleanliness. 

Thank you Sandy and staff at Akasha.. We will be back!!
title: Looooove this place 💕

text:
This is my 4th trip to Bali and over the years I've stayed in villas, hotels, 3 stars and 5 stars. Akasha was pretty disappointing.

First of all, I thought we got a pretty good deal on Agoda, we sent an email to reconfirm only to find out the 3 bedroom villa was actually a residence and had no pool and there was NO pool on the property. We had to cough up 250USD per night to upgrade to the 3 bedroom villa. I felt pretty conned because there was no mention of residence nor any photos of the residence on Agoda when we made the booking. So please beware.

The Akasha Residence

The Good
- lovely
- big
- clean
- free cookies

The Bad
- the AC in one of rooms was not working and they took hours to fix it... we were stuck because they left our main door wide open and we didn't feel safe just dropping everything and heading out. After 3 hours, we gave up and told them to please keep our things safe and they offered us a free breakfast for the trouble. We got back the beach and they still weren't done. Finally, after dinner everything was done but they didn't really clean up the mess they left behind. We moved the kids into master room with us because the smaller bedroom was soooo noisy with bikes and construction noise nearby.

The next day we move into the villa and my Mom who was traveling with us proclaimed it SWANKY. And it was. It's huge, lovely, beautiful BUT VERY VERY FLAWED. They just didn't maintain it. We were in Villa #8, perhaps we were unlucky but sigh...

The Bad
- the floors!!! In the master bed room this was a huge issue. The floors were warped, I love wood floors, I'm not sure how bad this quality was or if it was really thin wood on top of plastic but there were waves and dips and slopes! All the other rooms have warped floor but not as bad as the master.
- My kids took a bubble bath and it was filled up to only a foot of water (thankfully) and then they had their nap, I came back in and the toilet was flooded, urgh. I didn't dare take a bubble bath after
- TV only had good reception in the living room
- floor boards around the pool popped up
- Pool wasn't clean
- the rain showers were a joke, water spitting out from the sides
- the outdoor showers in the 2 other bedrooms you had to reach  the shower area only after you walked on pebbles (a simple tile would have solved that issue)
- there are this huge rusted metal sheets over the wall that really made the whole pretty villa, not so pretty, they could have use bamboo for additional privacy not metal sheets!
- privacy was an issue. There are doorways and doors which lead to the kitchen and the pool and you have to remember to lock your bedroom doors when you go out and when you sleep. I've never stayed in a villa like this. 
- mosquitoes - bring your own mosquito coils. Yes, they provide OFF and they spray your room during turn-down service but they do not provide or light the coils like most places in Bali. 
- the noisy AC units outside, argh.... 

The Good
- The kitchen was awesome, as was the living area and dining room
- The staff really did try
- It is in a great location, I just wish the walking to the shops and to the beach had some sort of safe pathway (which I'm sure would be filled with bikes so what's the point).
- it is so beautiful and huge just not kept well at all

 
I know I'll never stay here again, I don't think it's worth the money we paid which is such a pity because it could have been awesome but turned out just disappointing.

It's close to the beach and lotsa of massage places, cafes.

Oh and on the massage front. They don't have a spa, they get the nearby small massage shops to send someone over. The massage was okay but they didn't clean up after so there were pandan leaves and ginger in the bathtub. It was our last night and we didn't use that room so it didn't bother us but a bit strange. It cost us 35 over USD per pax but if you don't mind walking 2 mins it's 120,000 onwards so no more than 15 USD.

The breakfast was pretty decent, they cook and put it on the table and call one of the rooms  when they are done.
title: A Shame Really

owner_response.text:
Dear Value guest (ze_succubus)

Thank you for taking the time to write about your unfortunate experience in related with maintenance, services and our facilities. Our apologize that your stay was not as expected.
There were misunderstanding on your booking for Residence /apartment not our pool villa. Our residence or apartment description might not so clear on online travel partner and mix up with villas. As we were fully booked, regret we were only be able gave 1 night free upgrade to 3 Bedrooms Pool Villa and 1 night with additional fee with free breakfast. 

For your information our management had decided Not to advertise and taken off our residence/apartment  from online travel sites since early June. 

2013 is the most busy year we ever had, all our villas always fill up and nearly fully booked everyday.  We had many repeaters coming back and stayed with us again. Thank you for all guests who had chosen The Akasha Villas. 

We at The Akasha, strive to offer deluxe services experience to every guests that staying with us.  Therefore your feedback is very important to us. 

We will continue and put on top of our homework that refurbishment and an upgrade to our facilities and services will be continue to make sure all guests a comfortable stay.

Our Villa is designed in modern Balinese architecture which you might seen a lots of facilities and  furniture made from wood or natural stones. This is the uniqueness of The Akasha Villas that why many guests comment said they love come back and stay with us again. 

In the meantime, our pleasure to inform you that we have done some maintenance but unfortunately yet in villa that you stayed in. We plan to upgrade facilities of this villa very soon. 

We would like to thank you for your compliment to our kitchen and staffs. Our kitchen is set in modern and fully equipped. 

We appreciate your sharing your concerns and it is our hope that you will give us the opportunity to better serve you in the near future and show you the upgraded of The Akasha Villas.

Thank you and best regards,
Akasha Bali Management
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

locations.name: The Akasha Luxury Villas & Boutique Hotel
The Akasha Luxury Villas & Boutique Hotel

text:
We booked a 2 night accommodation at Akasha for a family of 7, and had a 4-room villa with a private pool to ourselves.

It was an amazing experience - service, food, etc were commendable. We had in-villa breakfast prepared for us in the fully equipped kitchen, in a grand dining hall/ living room area.

Highly recommended for couples, families who wish for tranquility, great service and a short 4-5 mins walk to the Seminyak beach.
title: Fantastic experience

text:
We booked the 4 bedroom villa for 9 of us including 3 kids.. The kids absolutely loved the place.. They couldn't wait to jump into the pool the moment we checked in...
The living room is huge and comfy...the kithcen was fully equipped if you needed to cook your meals.. microwave, fridge, stove, cutlery etc.. In fact, the staff cooked our breakfast every morning in the kitchen in plain sight...A wonderful experience indeed...
The bedrooms came with outdoor showers and bath tubs...The pool was nice and the staff kept it relatively clean as leaves and flowers would drop into the water when there s a bit of wind blowing...
The only downside to our stay was the Jacuzzi was out of action from the previous occupant who had "done something to it" we were informed by the staff... bummer.....
The beach is 2 minutes walk away but as the surfs were quite strong, you can only swim at designated spots on the beach which were marked by red/green flags... There are spas and bars nearby too..
3 minutes walk away from the resort s a little nice massage place which charges 50,000 rupiah (about USD5.00) for a full hour of body massage...What else could we ask for....I think it was called "Edelweis"
A further 5 minute walk away was our favourite foodie place "Naughty Nuri's" which served excellent BBQ ribs....If anything, this restaurant is most definitely  the reason for me to go back to this villa if anything... the ribs were just too mouth watering goodness.....
The villa staff were very attentive and helpful...5 star service.....they were happy to drop us in Seminyak area for food/shopping but you have to take a taxi back to the villa...
TIP: book vide 3rd party websites which are sometimes at 50% of the rack rate...
title: Good family villa

text:
We stayed in the 3 bedroom villa, it was amazing n spacious n so comfortable n clean our pool was huge. Breakfast was delicious n so much to chose from staff were very helpful and  friendly I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Bali for the first time I travelled with hubby n three kids in June weather was so nice n hot perfect for a holiday we would definitely go there again there are lots of nice restaurants near by to dine in. Luv it n miss it so much
Thank you to all the staff n managers that made our stay so relaxing n perfect
Rossielle & Nicholas
title: Best holiday ever

text: We have booked 4 Bedroom Private Pool Villa and were pleasantly surprised that they upgraded us to a Presidential 4 Bedrooms villa #1. The living room is very spacious and luxurious, so are the bedrooms. My extended family of 14 really enjoyed having a private pool. The staff was accommodating and served us both Asian and American breakfast for the 4 days’ stay. The staff is fantastic and their service is impeccable. Upon checkout, I had forgotten to pack my remote control for my media player. I only realised upon reaching my home country. I sms the staff and they managed to find it. They then told me that they will send the remote back to me and they did! A truly five-star quality service and stay.  I would highly recommend this place if you need to accommodate a big family. Once again to Akasha Villa Staff, thank you for making our stay so memorable. And thank you for sending the remote control back to me. Really appreciated the gesture!
title: Highly recommended!

text: I stayed at the 4 BR villa w/ private pool with a bunch of my "love to mingle" family members. There were 10 of us and even the living room is spacious enough. We had the 2-stories villa, with 2 bedroom downstairs and 2 bedrooms upstairs. It was perfect arrangement for all of us, since my mother in law is on wheelchair so she had the lower  bedroom. The swimming pool was adequate and clean. The pool guys cleaned all the leaves/flowers that had fallen to the pool from the prev night everyday. Breakfast is served freshly cooked at our kichenette by the requested time from us. So if u're not quite a morning person u can do 10am breakfast. Overall im satisfied with Akasha, very friendly staffs as well. And highly recommend this villa to travellers who come with more than 4 members. Even the location is very easy to reach . Another best part, it's located only 100m or less from NAUGHTY NURIs.. The best ribs in town, our fam favorite :)
title: Perfect for families, nice rooms

text:
Booked the villa for their one bedroom, but apparently they were placing us in the two bedroom villa. They just locked the other room and let us stayed in the master bathroom. We enjoyed staying in this villa a lot. The villa itself was spacious, the swimming pool was in great size, the kitchen, dining room, living room, bedroom, as well as the bathroom was spacious. Our master room has both indoor and outdoor shower. Their service was excellent. Check-in was fast and so did the cleaning service when they cleaned up the whole villa while we were still there. It only took them no more than 30 mins to clean up everything. Breakfast was made in your own villa and we can choose the breakfast we wanted when checking in.

The location was perfect too. It was only 1-2 mins drive to the famous naughty nuri's ribs in batu belig, and 5mins drive to the heart of seminyak (Kudeta, Potota Head Beach Club, etc). 

I was very satisfied with the overall stay in this villa. Will definitely come back
title: Spacious private pool villa, very close to the heart of seminyak

locations.name: The Akasha Luxury Villas & Boutique Hotel

photos.caption: swimming pool and door to the kitchen

locations.name: The Akasha Luxury Villas & Boutique Hotel

text: We are here from 28 to 30th May. Our children like it very much. The food was  tasty too. Transport  to surrounding provided but to pay for the return. Nice place and good for value. Swimming pool 1.5m depth, 4rooms villa. 300m from seaside....no beach. REALLY a Balinese villa! A few nice restraunt nearby and with in walking distance, like NURI'S, etc.
title: ENJOYING

text:
Overall, this was a nice place to chill with friends. The living room and bedrooms are very spacious and the pool is warm and inviting. The complimentary afternoon tea was a nice touch and the service staff even left the food in the fridge for us when we were away one afternoon. 

There were minor problems during our stay such as the erratic water flow of the outdoor shower, some lights that were faulty but they fixed that soon enough once we alerted them. 

What would have really topped the already good service is if they can light mosquito coils in all the rooms and living area every evening like what many other villas in Bali do. We had to tell them to do it (plus reminders) and gave up by the third night. 

The location is about a 10 min car ride to Seminyak centre. Although the villa provides complimentary on-demand shuttles to anywhere within Seminyak/Kuta (limited to 3 times a day), coming back to the villa was a tad annoying as you'll have to negotiate with the taxi drivers if you happen to flag down one tat is not using metered fare system. 

We stayed in Villa 11 and it was very noisy in the morning with the incessant honking of cars and motocycles engine noises. Couldn't really sleep in because of this. 

Bonus - a small mini mart, simple massage places and Naughty Nuri's are just a stone's throw away.
title: Very spacious, relaxing, good service

text:
did a lot of research as this is the first time we stayed in Seminyak.

Akasha had a few bad reviews but found them unwarranted. The staff was very friendly across the board. We were upgraded to a 4 bedroom villa upon arrival - which was an outstanding gesture given that we were celebrating a birthday.

The property was well maintained, and overall the villa was modern and traditional all in one - lets say: well decorated and "homely". Perhaps worth cleaning the sofas more often though. Otherwise, nothing to add or complain about - top place! 

On our birthday the staff brought us a bday cake. It was great. They also were booking us into nice spas and restaurants - thus helping us to oganise our day. 

Once, the chef was away, and we bought fresh fish and wanted to cook them for lunch... the staff was very apologetic, gave us a bottle of prosecco and tried to cook the fish for us too :) turned out just fine... The breakfast is fine, but honestly nothing special - just nice... i would either cook myself or go to a cafe... one tip: get coffee Lewak! the local speciality. get it in powder from a supermarket like Carrefour... its a real morning treat and quite expensive elsewhere in the world.

Oh, and stay away from the massage/spa menu... the girls that come by were not good. Instead, have the guys book you into Prana Spa... not far at all and a good experience. 

The location of the villa is good. There is a small beach just a walk away - nothing special but nice to hear the ocean. You do need a CAR or a driver to get to places though. But we found a driver, paying him 450k rupiah per day and that was good enough. 

We will be coming back.
title: short trip to Bali

text:
The villas are great, the staff are very very kind. Nice decoration.
Just 3 minutes walking from the beach, but you can not get into the sea ( it is dangerous)
Very quiet area. 
Room service ok
Free taxi to Seminyak and pick up at the airport.
title: Quiet

text: I've been to Bali now approximately 20 times, spread over a 12 year period, and have stayed in a wide variety of accommodations ranging from hotels to resorts to villas.  In those cases in which I've stayed at villas (at least 10 different villas), most have been outstanding in quality, service, and amenities and have ranged in location from Kuta in the south north to Batu Belig.  Based on this fairly extensive experience base, I'd say The Akasha Villas are at the very top of my list and rate a "very highly recommended" rating.  First, you simply can't beat the location.  75 meters from the beach and located right off Jl. Batu Belig, you will experience an ideal blend of laid-back tranquility and enough energy generated from the ample restaurants and warungs along the road to keep you busy.   Second, the villas themselves are large, well appointed, and contain some of the largest private pools I have experienced in the many in which I've stayed in Bali.  Finally, and most importantly...the Akasha Staff is extremely friendly, polite, engaging, committed, and dedicated to their tasks.  They combine a quality that I particularly favor in Villas:  Then engage with you personally, and regularly, to make you feel as if you are interacting with family; however, they are careful to not be so intrusive to spoil the tranquility of your private villa.  When you combine the very competitive rates with the above-mentioned qualities, you have the formula for a 5-star vacation and a equally 5-star experience.  I've stayed at Akasha now 4 times.  I have already booked for two more visits to Akasha in 2013.   I can think of no better, or more genuine endorsement, of a villa like Akasha then to put my money where my mouth is.   Akasha Villas is my home away from home!
title: "A Gem in Batu Belig"

text:
We went here a couple of months ago for a friend's 30th birthday. 16 of us were split across the 4-bedroom and 3-bedroom adjacent villas. The villas were simply brilliant. And in fact, we barely moved the party outside the 2 villas. 
The pool was fab, the in-room massages were super and the breakfast was pretty good. The service was also great. Except, I don't think they cleaned the pool during our 3-day stay, so by the end of it, the water was anything but inviting.
title: Great villas

text: We were a party of 6 and we stayed in villa 10. We found the experience very pleasant. Staffs were very friendly and went out of the way to help with what we needed. We found the rooms quite pleasant and the layout of the separate living room/kitchen and the three bedrooms ensured that we got the privacy needed while still having a central meeting place - the living room. One small problem which another reviewer had mentioned was the bad/fuzzy reception for the tv in living room and rooms. They also didn't replace the toiletries e.g bath gels, soaps after the first day which another reviewer also mentioned. I would recommend the villa to do this to enhance travellers' stay at the villa. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay and we enjoyed the experience.
title: Good experience

text:
The service staff were excellent, trying very hard to make our stay pleasant. However, it is let down by a few problems, the biggest being the toilets! The toilet flush was simply not working despite their attempts to fix it. The problem recurred every morning! Almost tempted to give this hotel a 2 star because of this.

bcheong's review is spot on. Nothing else to add to that.
title: Average Villas

text:
We were a party of 16 old friends from all over the world and converged in Bali/Akasha for a few nights. We booked 3 3-bedroom villas. A few days before our stay, we were informed that 1 of the villas was not available and they "upgraded" us to a 4-bedroom villa. "upgraded" in inverted commas since they locked the 4th bedroom. ahem. I'll break down this review into the good and not-so-good and the locked 4th bedroom and go into the not-so-good bucket

The Good
- Located in Seminyak, the Akasha is just next to a BBQ joint mentioned several times in previous reviews. their ribs and tuna steaks are indeed very good. Akasha is also close to Seminyak town, Potatohead, KuDeTa etc. if that's your thing
- Also mentioned, is that they have free hotel shuttles for places you need to get to within Seminyak, like the town. Potatohead etc. This is subject to availability as i think they only have 1 van
- The reception and check-in was ok, no major hassles and delay
- They make breakfast for you in the villa - eggs, noodles etc. and it's a nice start to each day. For eggs, do not choose the scrambled eggs though, not well done
- Also mentioned, they also make complimentary tea, but the sandwiches , cakes etc. is not something you'll write home about

The Not-so-good
- This being Seminyak, you are far away from other locales like Ubud for the art and rafting. Bali traffic has worsened exponentially since 5-10 years ago and the pervious 45min car ride now becomes 2-2.5hours
- The toilet bowls in 2 rooms of my villa acted up almost throughout our stay. I'm not sure if the other villas had the same problem but my friend told me he saw the maintenance guy walk around with the declogger. To not be able to deliver something as basic as a working toilet bowl, this is disappointing
- The bedroom safe was also not easy to deal with and there were no instructions pasted on the safe , like most hotels
- the air-conditioning was also never perfect, it was either too warm or too cold, the remote or the AC unit itself, wasn't working too well
- They also didn't replace the toiletries like soap, bath gel, mouthwash etc. after the 1st day
- this is certainly not a 5 star experience - there are no fluffy towels, ipod players in the room. The flat screen tv in the bedrooms are small, and some have fuzzy reception. The tv in the living room also had fuzzy reception
- The bedroom sliding door was also a pain and you always need 2 hands, some strength and some artistry to lock and unlock your door each time
- Our villa 10 had the cleanest pool it seems. Villas 11 and 12 had too many leaves and flowers dropping into the pool daily and the leaves had a lot of insects on them. Not a really pleasant swim
- The 4-bedroom villa living room had an ipod player, but the 3-bedroom villas don't. The master bedroom in the 4-bedroom villa was also larger with a larger bathroom and his-and-her sinks
- We also had mosquito problems and i guess being Bali, we have to put up with this, and the frantic construction all over Bali is probably not helping
- Check-out unfortunately was painful compared to check-in. Apparently the reception needs a manager to sort this out and she wasn't around when we wanted to do it. After 20mins, she and a team of 2-3 staff spent 20mins to check-out 1 room before me, before they could attend to me. Not exactly the most efficient of systems

All in all, an average experience at the villa, and fortunately our group had a great time being together despite the above
title: Certainly not the best around

text:
We have the pleasure of staying at Akasha in late May and I highly recommend it. We were a group of 8 adults - friends and family - in Bali to celebrate a birthday and we had Villa 1 (a 4 bedroom).

The villa itself was perfect for a group. The layout of the sleeping vs living areas meant there was plenty of space for us all to stretch out without ever feeling crowded. 
And the pool provided a great central feature.

The standard of the fitout and furnishings was excellent, rooms were comfortable, clean and very liveable. The kitchen was huge and made a great communal area.

Akasha's staff were lovely, attentive, incredibly helpful and clearly dedicated to ensuring the guests had a good time. They provided afternoon tea every day, which was always delicious and a fun surprise (varied from cakes, to sandwiches, to sliders and french fries!). The shuttle service was convenient and always available, but local taxis were always easy to flag down as well.

Breakfasts weren't always spot on (orders mixed up and often cold) but never inedible. If anything, this proved extra entertainment for us as we placed bets on who's eggs would be overcooked! 

The location is excellent - handy to Seminyak, but a bit more low key. It was a short walk down the beach to Potatohead (the best beach bar/restaurant in Bali), W Hotel and La Lucciola. 

I highly recommend Akasha to groups and families with children (perhaps not suitable for very young children because of the pool being between sleeping and living areas and un-fenced).
title: Wonderful!

owner_response.text:
Thank you for taking your precious time to write such a wonderful review for The Akasha Villas. Our team are very happy to hear that all of you enjoy your stay with us especially,  you were celebrating your special day.  Yes, our creative team always create something special to our daily complimentary afternoon tea to surprise our guests.  
Our Villa is only few minutes walk to W Hotel, Potato Head, La Luciola, Kudeta  if you walk through the beach but free shuttle is available and ready to drop you around Seminyak area. For your information Mozaic Beach Club has just opened last month. It is only 10 minutes walk from The Akasha Villas.
Our Villa pool has few steps for young children. However for young child in swimming pool will need parents supervise. For child safety, we can provide pool fence without any extra charge that we can be erected around the pool.  

Once again thank you for your kind review, we look forward to welcoming you at The Akasha Villas in near future.

All the best from The Akasha team
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
The villa was clean and luxurious. The staff was courteous and responsive. Amenities included a nice, small swimming pool and a jacuzzi (I never used the latter, so I can't comment on it). My room was clean, with plenty of space, a comfortable bed, plenty of lighting options, and a much-needed, very effective air conditioner. Breakfast included plenty of options and plenty of food. The cleaning staff was very effective. My only gripe (very minor) is that the TV in my room didn't seem to work, but I don't watch much TV anyway, so I never asked about it--also, there was a perfectly functional set in the villa's common room.
Things I didn't rate, and why:
Value--someone else was paying, so I can't comment.
Location--this was my only time visiting Bali, so I don't know enough to judge.
Spa--if the Akasha had one, I never used it.
title: An opulent experience

text:
We recently returned from 8 nights in the 4 bedroom Royal Villa. As this was a 30th Wedding Anniversary celebration with our family we wanted a large villa with privacy not too far from Seminyak - and that is exactly what we got. Our villa was very quiet - you didn't even know there were other villas nearby.

The staff were amazing - nothing was too much trouble and they were always cheerful and welcoming. 
The rooms are all very nice, though a touch of brightness with a little more colour would help enhance the rooms. The bathrooms were all lovely and spacious with plenty of space for two. A few more coathangers in the wardrobes and hairdryers in the bathrooms would be ideal. But when we asked for hairdryers, an iron and ironing board we were quickly given them. 
The one way shuttle was excellent and nearly always available - taxis are cheap so on the odd occasion if you need to use one it is not a problem.
We all had wonderful massages from the Akasha Spa - more expensive than the ones nearby - but luxury under the open air Bale.
There are 2 money changers and 2 mini marts a couple of minutes away which was really handy. 
Naughty Nuris is a must - fantastic ribs and wondeful Tuna steaks and 5 minutes walk.
A few small points that could be improved upon -
Breakfast - a few specials would be good - especially when you are there for more than a few days.
Staff need to ensure all food is hot for guests - we did have a small problem on day 1 but our Butlers (Kardek & Winda & Asst. Manager Suni) ensured that breakfast was great from then on.
Paper napkins for breakfast (instead of tissues).
Extra toilet rolls in the bathrooms and an extra towel (I asked and got one) is nicer.
All in all a great stay with staff who care - we hope to be back next year!
title: Wonderful staff

text:
The Akasha private beach villas are located on the quieter side of Seminyak, about a 10 minute car-ride away from the more commercialised side of Seminyak Square, where all the main boutiques, shops, cafes and restaurants, etc are located. 
We stayed in the 3 bedroom villa and the rooms are simple and spacious, though on the spartan side. The two main villas come with a queen's bed while the smaller villa has two single beds. 
The pool of a good size is in the middle of the garden area though kids under the age of say 2 or 3 will require close supervision as the depth is about a metre or so.
The common living room is huge and come with generous sofa seatings, the standard flat screen, dvd, dock, etc while the kitchen and dining is adequate with microoven, cutleries and utensils and the dining table is enough to seat a party of 8-10 persons.
 
The pros-
-daily groceries well taken care of with two supermarkets nearby.
-daily complementary tea-breaks with an assortment of cakes and pastries.
-free transport to the main Seminyak area but do note it is only for one way.
-helpful and caring staff who will go out of their way to accomodate all your requests.
-a short 5 minute walk away, there is Naughty Nuri's, arguably one of the best barbecue joints in the Seminyak area. Forget about their local dishes but instead go for the barbecue ribs and the tuna steak! Its simply irresistible! Also try and avoid the normal lunch and dinner hours as the joint is virtually packed and it will take awhile before food can be served.
-a few massage joints are to be found a few shops away from Nuri's, that provide cheap and reasonably good head, foot and body massages. I mean seriously what's there not to be good when you are only paying slightly less than usd6 for an hour's massage?    

The cons-
-our main gripe was that being surrounded by trees and greenery, there were mozzies everywhere to make our stay comfortable. Despite the abundance of mosquitoe coils and repellant, we were bitten practically everywhere in the living room, in the villa rooms, in the shower which by the way is half open air-concept, by the pool area, etc. There is simply no escape and this is one main issue Akasha management must look into.
-free wi-fi is consistently unstable and keep dying from time to time.     
-breakfast selection is pretty limited and maybe a bigger portion will be appreciated. Say a tiny single piece of bacon or a sausage is certainly not many people's idea of an American breakfast?
-the shower room is spacious and nice but there just isn't enough hooks to hang our clothes? Beside a single hook in the shower cubicle, the shower room was in a mess as our dirty clothings, wet clothings were lying everywhere on the floor, on the bath-tub, on the tap in the open air shower, etc..  Simply, anywhere we can lay it out.
-the beach is just a short walk away, but i'm not sure why it is called Akasha private beach cos the beach is virtually open to everyone. On the day we were there, there was even this bloke at the entry point charging a fee on all motor-bikers heading for the beach. Incidentally, the beach is dirty and poorly maintained and certainly not one where we look forward to.
-power supply is erratic and prone to breakdown. In one of the nights where it broke down twice, i was caught off guard and stranded in total darkness while in the midst of my shower, while the rest of the lads were having their drinks by the pool.
title: The good and also the bad......

text:
I went there for a bachelor party with my friends. We stayed at the 3 bedrooms villas for 2 nights over the weekend. Overall the interior is nice. It was composed of 3 small houses (the living room - house, the master bedroom - house, and master & twin rooms house). It has a pool in the garden that u can use, a parking spot fit for one car, free breakfast (freshly made every morning at your kitchen)

It's a nice place to throw a small party (10 peops) since it has its own kitchen, refrigerator, glasses (wine & shots), pans, water dispenser, long wood table, and other cutleries.
about the amenities, they don't have hairdryer inside the villas, so u have to call the housekeeping.
They only provide each room a pair of towels,sandals,toothbrush, etc (very basic). Warning: they don't spare extra toilet tissues ready in house. I was out of tissues and have to call the operator in the middle of night asking for toilet tissues and napkins. also, since it's on villa and it;s on BALI, don't be surprised to find some animals at your rooms such as mosquitoes, mini spiders, and birds (yeap! got a bird inside my room) 

Overall it's one of nice villas in Seminyak area. It;s definitely a new, clean, modern wooden villa not an old, hay roof made, dirty villa. the location is nice, it's near beach also near the famous Nuri's Indonesian Pork Ribs, seminyak branch. 

About the service, I was disappointed with the miscommunication that the staffs had which ruined my breakfast. Me and my friends (stay at villas 8) ordered a very specific breakfast (eggs n pancakes) a day before for the next day breakfast. But, turn out, in the next morning, they only serve cold breakfast (cereal and bread). The villa staff told us that the other villa (our other friends) requested cereals for "all of them". The staffs mistaken the word "all of them" as the whole guests who stays in the other villa. As we have an early noon flight, we don't have time for them preparing our warm eggs and pancakes. 

About the price and deposits, I don;t really know the detail as it's my friend who arranged the trip.
title: Nice Villa and good location

owner_response.text:
First of all, we would like to thank you for your positive feedback to The Akasha Villas.
Most of our guests chosen as they come in small group with their family or friends or business partners. We provide full of privacy and facility for our guests who would like to have small meeting while on holiday or birthday  celebration or wedding anniversary or small wedding reception, celebrate special occasion, family or friends gathering. We can also arrange a private BBQ dinner  and cocktail party in the villa .  Each of our villa has pantry to keep all the villa amenities. Our 24 hours butler services will be happy to assist our guests during  stay. 

We always maintain and keep our villa and garden green, clean and lush. Sometime our guests find some butterfly or  bird singing in the morning.

Yes, we are only 5 minutes walk to Naughty Nuris and new Mosaic Beach Club is also 10 minutes walk from our villa.

We are sorry regarding miscommunication about breakfast on your last day. We had double check to our staff regarding the breakfast order, apparently your friends who stayed in second villa  requested to change it . But our apologize that our staff did not confirm back to you prior to confirm the second breakfast order.  This will be a highlight for our butlers to improve their services to our guests.

Thank you so much for your kind feedback. We hope to see you again at The Akasha
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
This is the first time I have ever written a review but I felt I had to warn people. I booked a 1 bedroom villa/ 2 people for 4 nights via booking.com at a discounted price as advertised by the site. A day later, the villa sent me an email saying the villa was full and requested for a deposit of one night stay to be paid by a bank transfer into their account. Luckily I refused and told them that I would settle the bills when I got there – they called me twice about the same thing which I thought it was a bit odd. I checked the booking confirmation and found out that Akasha Villa changed the rate after I had booked and imposed a charge of US$4,500 for the final night which brought the total up to US$6,100!! They didn’t mention this when they called me and it definitely wasn’t the rate that I agreed to pay when made a reservation. 

This is insane, it’s Bali and a 5 star hotel next door would not charge that much for a 4 night stay at their luxury pool suite. The villa confirmed that was the correct rate / currency but couldn’t give me a valid reason why they would charge me an $4,500 per night – a RIP OFF!! I told them I wanted to cancel but no action was taken. I called the villa several times but the manager was never available and had no decency to return my calls to resolve the issues. I reported this to Booking.com although they were really helpful and trying to sort it out but also had difficulty in dealing with them too. Akasha Villa never confirmed my cancellation and later on I received an email saying that as a "no show" I would be charged for one night stay - I was furious!! It’s a total CON!! I believe this is a scam to make money and there’s no chance in hell that they would get a penny from me. They have caused me a lot of hassles, ruined my experience and we had to find somewhere else to stay at the very last minute. This happened a couple of weeks ago and I would not recommend this villa to anyone.
title: BEWARE!!

owner_response.text:
Thank you for your input to The Akasha Villas Bali. Since this just happened, please let us explain and refresh about your booking.  We have received your booking made via booking.com on May 15, 2012 for the period of May 31 – June 4, 2012 total  4 nights with rate, 31 may : USD399, 1 - 2 june : US$650, 3 june US$4,500. Hence June 3, 2012 , all our  villas are fully booked, so we increased our price to US$4,500 just for June 3, 2012 to avoid people making reservation. Since we have a special agreement with booking.com, we are not allowed to close any availability even we are fully booked. So the option was to increase the price high to avoid guest making a booking. On the other hand, if we received a booking, we have to upgrade to other luxury villas with some benefits that we have to offer.
We had call you twice and sent email when we had received your reservation as we were very surprise that you made a booking though with this rate. We have clarified that you are sure to take this booking and agree for the such high rate that we published online and you said yes. Then we upgraded your villa, provided you with VIP arrival service, full time butler including car and driver that you can use during your stay.  We required 1 night deposit because we would like to make sure the booking is still definite as we can not process the credit card without it is swiped on our machine.  But you said that the booking is definite and you will pay cash on arrival by mentioning specific amount of US$6,100.
But when we received your call few days before your arrival, you explain that you thought the rate was in HK$ not USD. All internet shoppers should aware before they purchase something. We believe Booking.com offers friendly booking system and quite easy to understand. 
At the end you have revised your booking to 1 night May 31 – June 1, 2012 cost at US$399.  But you did not show up to our villa and we did Not charge you anything.
owner_response.title: Tanggapan Pemilik

text:
We had a three bedroom villa and it was very nice and spacious. The staff were reliable and accomodating. We needed our breakfast by 7:30am every morning and they promptly arrived at 7am to cook and prepare breakfast in a very mild and unintrusive manner- great.

The cleanliness of the place can be improved but nothing to deter travellers. Perhaps we can suggest having a bin in the kitchen and maybe provide more cultery.

Overall a very pleasant experience we will will happily return
title: A good value villa close to the beach

text:
Travelling with three boys under 3 we needed to stay in a villa that had all the rooms in the same building.  The villas were very nice here however the living area was separate to the bedrooms which were also all separate so the five of us had to stay in one room for the one night we stayed there.  The manager was so lovely after I explained the villa wasnt suitable for us she allowed us to leave without penalty.

The living area was clean, modern however the aircon was not very good, to small for the area and barely worked.  They did send someone to have a look but it didn't make much difference.

They served afternoon tea once we arrived, fresh hot pineapple pancakes, yum!!

The pool was gorgeous, right in the sun, huge and just the right temperature and private.

There was a car to take us around which was handy as the villa is not in the main area.

The staff were so nice and the morning we were meant to check out they brought over a box of toys and set them up for the boys to play with. It was the highlight of their trip.

The breakfast was great and plentiful.

We didn't get to the beach as we there only for a short one night, buyt it was walking distance.

STAFF WERE FANTASTIC
title: Best villa breakfast, clean, modern with a great pool.

title: Elegant
